definition: to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: The warfare becomes critical like this, having may let Gong does the east rather and alone go to the capital?
sentences.chinese: 战事这样吃紧，有没有可能让龚东宁单独进京？

sentences.english: "The labor market is tight, " Mr. DesRochers said.
sentences.chinese: “劳动力市场吃紧，”德斯罗切尔斯说。

sentences.english: On top of that, coal supplies are tight.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，电煤供应吃紧。

sentences.english: A scholar should keep the mind busy when at leisure, and maintain a relaxed state when busy.
sentences.chinese: 故君子闲时要有吃紧的心思，忙处要有悠闲的趣味。

sentences.english: When money is in short supply,many businesses fail.
sentences.chinese: 银根吃紧时，许多企业会倒闭。

definition: lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
to be in a state of emergency/to report an emergency/to ask for emergency assistance
income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
to move an army and send a general (idiom); to deploy an army/to send a team on a task
to add hail to snow (idiom); one disaster on top of another/to make things worse in a bad situation
very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
